intro: Polygala dewevrei, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Polygala dewevrei is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
